name: JOHNSTON SCHOOL COMMITTEE v. JOHNSTON FEDERATION OF TEACHERS
name_abbreviation: Johnston School Committee v. Johnston Federation of Teachers

parties: JOHNSTON SCHOOL COMMITTEE v. JOHNSTON FEDERATION OF TEACHERS.

opinions.text:
ORDER
Since the Superior Court’s ruling in this case is appealable, the petition for writ of certiorari is hereby denied, without prejudice, however, to petitioner’s filing a notice of appeal if and when a judgment is entered below.

attorneys: Frank Caprio Law Offices, Frank Caprio, Providence, for petitioner.
Abedon, Michaelson, Stanzler, Biener, Skolnik & Lipsey, Richard A. Skolnik, Providence, for respondent.
casebody.head_matter:
JOHNSTON SCHOOL COMMITTEE v. JOHNSTON FEDERATION OF TEACHERS.
No. 81-567-M.P.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
Jan. 28, 1982.
Frank Caprio Law Offices, Frank Caprio, Providence, for petitioner.
Abedon, Michaelson, Stanzler, Biener, Skolnik & Lipsey, Richard A. Skolnik, Providence, for respondent.
